page.title: 12AGRICULTURE
page.content: The local farms are either areas of about 80 acres owned and farmed by a farmer or by partnerships of about 800 acres managed by farm managers. The small farmers tend to concentrate on single crops,while partnerships rotate their crops.Wheat,barley,oats,potatoes,sugar beet,vining peas for freezing and canning,oil seed rape and grass are used in various combinations. Smaller farmers sell produce at their own shops or to local merchants.Partnerships sell some to local market groups or for export.All farmers use machinery extensively,they also spray for pests and fungii,and feed the soil with manure and fertilizer.
